Menpora Akui GBT Bau Tak Sedap
03 Nov 2019, 19:40 by Anik Hasanah


Menpora Akui GBT Bau Tak Sedap

KBRN, Surabaya : Menteri Pemuda dan Olahraga (Menpora), Zainudin Amali ingin memastikan kondisi dan fasilitas yang dimiliki oleh stadiin Gelora Bung Tomo (GBT), dengan langsung melihat ke lokasi. Namun Menpora tidak bisa masuk kedalam stadion, lantaran pintu gerbang terkunci. Padahal, berdasarkan informasi, Dinas Pemuda dan Olahraga (Dispora) Jatim sudah koordinasi dengan Dispora Surabaya. Menpora mengakui, jika aroma tidak sedap tercium diluar stadion. "Masih tercium (bau tidak sedap, red) belum hilang gitu loh," ujarnya, Minggu (3/11/2019).Sehingga, kata Menpora, untuk penyelesaiannya, harus ada kerjasama antar pemerintah daerah, baij Pemerintah Provinsi dan Pemerintah Kota, serta stakholder yang terkait seperti KONI, kemudian PSSI Jawa Timur."Harus dicarikan jalan keluarnya," tambah politisi asal Jatim tersebut. Salah satu persoalan, yakni aroma kurang sedap, bisa saja menjadi pengganjal GBT menjadi satu diantara 6 stadion yang akan menjadi venue penyelenggaraan Piala Dunia U-20 tahun 2021. Tapi kata Menpora, masih ada faktor penentu lainnya. "Tapi kan akses masuk, segala macam, kemudian lapangan pendukung, juga jadi pertimbangan," imbuhnya. Sebagai Menteri asal Jatim, Zainudin Amali mengaku ingin agar salah satu stadion di Jatim terpilih. Sehingga diperlukan koordinasi semua pihak, untuk menentukan stadion mana yang dianggap layak. "Makanya kita harus duduk tanpa cari siapa yang salah, kita mencari supaya bagaimana jalan keluar dan persyaratan yang ditetapkan oleh FIFA itu bisa kita penuhi," paparnya.

Menpora Admits GBT Smells Smelly
03 Nov 2019, 19:40 by Anik Hasanah


Menpora Admits GBT Smells Smelly

KBRN, Surabaya: Minister of Youth and Sports (Menpora), Zainudin Amali wants to ensure the conditions and facilities owned by the Gelora Bung Tomo (GBT) stadium, by directly looking at the location. But the Menpora cannot enter the stadium, because the gate is locked. In fact, based on information, the East Java Youth and Sports Office (Dispora) has coordinated with Surabaya Dispora. The Menpora admitted, if the odor was unpleasant outside the stadium. "It still smells (unpleasant odor, red) has not disappeared yet," he said, Sunday (11/03/2019). So, said the Minister of Youth and Sports, for its completion, there must be cooperation between the regional government, provincial and city government baij related stakholders such as KONI, then PSSI East Java. "A solution must be found," added the politician from East Java. One problem, namely the unpleasant odor, could have been a booster of GBT being one of the 6 stadiums that will be the venue for the 2021 U-20 World Cup. But the Menpora said, there were still other determining factors. "But the entrance, all kinds, then the supporting field, is also a consideration," he added. As Minister from East Java, Zainudin Amali said he wanted to have one of the stadiums in East Java selected. So that coordination is needed by all parties, to determine which stadiums are considered appropriate. "So we have to sit down without looking for who is wrong, we are looking for how to get out and the conditions set by FIFA that we can fulfill," he explained.
